channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2017 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump gets royal welcome in Saudi as scandals swirl at home
Golden treatment: Saudis present Trump with medal
item.description: Saudi King Salman presented President Trump with a gold medal, the Collar of Abdulaziz Al Saud, the nation's highest honor.

item.title: Melania and Ivanka Trump arrive in Saudi Arabia sans headscarves
item.description: First lady Melania Trump and first daughter Ivanka Trump arrived in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, Saturday morning sporting an absence of headscarves.

item.title: Iran's Rouhani wins re-election in victory for moderates
Russians bragged that they could use Flynn
item.description: Russian officials bragged in conversations during the presidential campaign that they had cultivated a strong relationship with former Trump adviser retired Gen. Michael Flynn and believed they could use him to influence Donald Trump and his team, sources told CNN.

item.title: Comey 'believes Trump was trying to influence him'
item.description: Former FBI Director James Comey now believes that President Donald Trump was trying to influence his judgment about the Russia probe, a person familiar with his thinking says, but whether that influence amounts to obstruction of justice remains an open question.

item.title: 'Nut job': Trump bragged to Russian about firing Comey
item.description: President Donald Trump bragged to two top Russian officials last week that firing "nut job" FBI Director James Comey eased "great pressure" on him, The New York Times reported Friday.

item.title: Pippa Middleton weds millionaire in front of royals and stars
item.description: Royalty and celebrities gathered Saturday to watch as Philippa Charlotte "Pippa" Middleton, the younger sister of Catherine, the Duchess of Cambridge, married millionaire hedge fund manager, James Matthews, in Englefield, England.

item.title: White House lawyers researching impeachment
item.description: White House lawyers have begun researching impeachment procedures in an effort to prepare for what officials still believe is a distant possibility that President Donald Trump could have to fend off attempts to remove him from office, two people briefed on the discussions tell CNN.

item.title: Photos show Times Square driver trying to flee carnage
item.description: Charles Guerin was making his daily trip through Times Square on Thursday just before noon when he saw and heard a car speeding on the sidewalk and people screaming.

item.title: Kushner calls Lockheed over $100B Saudi arms deal
item.description: President Donald Trump's son-in-law and utility diplomat, Jared Kushner, shocked a high-level Saudi delegation earlier this month when he personally called Lockheed Martin CEO Marillyn Hewson and asked if she would cut the price of a sophisticated missile detection system, according to a source with knowledge of the call.

item.title: Storm chasers killed chasing tornado
item.description: Three storm chasers were killed in a car accident while chasing a tornado in Texas.

item.title: Formula E: Buemi victorious as di Grassi crashes down and out in Paris
item.description: Sebastien Buemi tightened his grip on the 2016/17 Formula E World Championship with another commanding performance at Saturday's Paris ePrix.

item.title: Saudi Arabia and US companies reach $55 billion in deals
item.description: Saudi Arabia announced more than $55 billion in deals with US companies Saturday, coinciding with President Donald Trump's arrival here for a two-day visit.

item.title: Assange: 'I cannot forgive or forget injustice'
item.description: Sweden is dropping its investigation into WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange on rape allegations, according to a prosecution statement released Friday.

item.title: Russia: US strike on convoy 'unacceptable'
item.description: Russia has condemned a series of US coalition airstrikes on a military convoy allied with President Bashar al-Assad in Syria as "totally unacceptable."

item.title: Obama VP: I never thought Clinton was great
item.description: Former Vice President Joe Biden still isn't done with Hillary Clinton and the 2016 election -- and that may be why he refuses to rule out running again for president in 2020.

item.title: Speaking on Islam, will Trump hit reset with Muslims?
item.description: A month after Donald Trump called for a "total and complete shutdown" of Muslims entering the US, a hijab-wearing American named Rose Hamid stood up in the grandstands a few rows behind the presidential candidate.

item.title: Why Trump's first foreign tour is unusual
item.description: Trump sets off after 119 days in office -- later than any other president in the last 50 years.

item.title: Source: DHS secretary hints at US laptop ban
item.description: A congressional aide who was in the room when Homeland Security Secretary John Kelly briefed lawmakers tells CNN the ban on electronics on certain US-bound flights from the Middle East and North Africa could expand not just to Europe, as is being discussed, but also to flights departing from the US to overseas.

item.title: Fox News host sacked for 'insensitive remark' to black employee
London airport's new control tower won't have anyone inside
New footage shows Erdogan watching Washington brawl
item.description: New video footage has emerged that shows Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan looking on as Turkish security officials beat up protesters outside the country's embassy in Washington earlier this week.

item.title: Erdogan watches brawl outside Turkish embassy
item.description: Video has emerged of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan watching-on as violence erupted outside the Turkish embassy in Washington, DC.

item.title: Chris Cornell's wife disputes 'intentional' suicide finding
item.description: Chris Cornell's widow disputed an official finding that her rocker husband died by suicide and revealed Friday that he had "taken an extra Ativan or two" shortly before he was found unresponsive.

item.title: 'Kissing bug' disease deadlier than thought
item.description: The nickname given to the insects that spread Chagas disease is somewhat bittersweet: kissing bugs.

item.title: Ex-MotoGP champ 'critical' after crash
item.description: Former MotoGP world champion Nicky Hayden is in a "extremely critical" condition in intensive care after a cycling accident in Italy.

item.title: Antarctica's icy landscape turning green
item.description: Antarctica is home to ice, penguins and -- thanks to climate change -- rapidly increasing levels of moss, scientists say.

item.title: Parasitic infection risks in swimming pools
item.description: Beware of contaminated pool water: Outbreaks of a parasitic diarrhea-causing infection linked to pools and water playgrounds doubled in the United States from 2014 to 2016, according to the Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report issued Thursday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

item.title: These girls joined an all-boys soccer league -- and won it all
item.description: Andrea Gmez beat the boys on the soccer field game after game, and by the end of the season, the goalkeeper and her teammates clinched the top spot in an otherwise all-male league.

item.title: The match that changed football
Weight loss can be tied to when you eat
item.description: If you are trying to lose weight and otherwise improve your health, you may already be mindful about what you eat during the day.

item.title: The worst social media app for young people's mental health...
item.description: Instagram is the most detrimental social networking app for young people's mental health, followed closely by Snapchat, according to a new report by the Royal Society for Public Health (RSPH) in the UK.

item.title: Goodbye high seas, hello cubicle: Could sailing be the next desk job?
Why do aliens look this way?
item.description: In 1979, none of the promotional material for the film "Alien" showed moviegoers even a glimpse of the titular creature.

item.title: Psychology of recycling: Why we may choose not to
item.description: Have you ever had your name spelled wrong on a disposable cup in a coffee shop?

item.title: Trump, dogged by controversy in DC, kicks off overseas trip in Saudi Arabia
item.description: President Donald Trump has landed in Saudi Arabia for his first stop abroad since taking office, a visit meant to bolster partnerships abroad that aides hope can reset a scandal-pocked narrative back home.

item.title: 'Better than Obama': What Saudis think of Donald Trump
item.description: A south Asian merchant sits on a blanket covered with neatly arranged twigs. He is surrounded by men eager to get their hands on his product. To an outsider, the scene is puzzling. But the twigs are tooth cleaners known as miswak, and they harken back to the time of Islam's Prophet Mohammed.

item.title: Russia foreign minister denies talking to Trump about Comey
item.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov denies discussing the firing of former FBI Director James Comey with President Donald Trump during his White House visit earlier this month.

item.title: Israelis on edge before Trump visit
item.description: Only days before President Donald Trump visits Jerusalem, Israeli politicians describe an atmosphere of "nervousness" and "confusion."

item.title: Passenger 'duct taped to seat' on flight
item.description: A man who caused a disturbance aboard an American Airlines flight from Los Angeles to Hawaii on Friday was overpowered by passengers and crew and taped to a seat, passengers said.

item.title: UK election: May's extraordinary coup
item.description: Theresa May should be having a bad election campaign.

item.title: Video shows moment of New York crash
item.description: Police say the car hit at least one person before it came to a stop.

item.title: Huma Abedin to divorce Anthony Weiner
item.description: Huma Abedin has filed for divorce from former Rep. Anthony Weiner, a move she made prior to Weiner pleading guilty Friday to transferring obscene material to a minor, a source familiar with the matter told CNN.

item.title: Preakness: One of sport's most fabled feats
item.description: It's one of American sport's most fabled feats.

item.title: 15 products that push the boundaries of design
item.description: A one-stop inspiration shop for design lovers and neophytes alike, the website Sight Unseen (and its highly addictive Instagram profile) has a devoted, international following of the aesthetically inclined.

item.title: Superbenches: An unusual take on public seating
item.description: The park bench is a familiar and often overlooked design that exists in cities across the world. Typically designed to have mass appeal, and manufactured from materials that can withstand frequent use, constant exposure to the elements and vandalism, these seats provide a valuable but perhaps unrecognized service.

item.title: Why all-female shows are popping up all over New York
item.description: On the tails of Milan's massive design week in April, New York City's citywide festival of design, NYCxDesign -- which runs through May 24 -- kicked off with a spate of shows giving voice to female talent in an industry that remains notoriously male-dominated.

item.title: Off-the grid luxury in paradise
item.description: Whether you're in search of an all-inclusive luxury resort or a chilled-out beach villa, the Philippines has no shortage of remote retreats to whisk intrepid travelers off the grid.
